page.title: 07Stainton Church
page.content: St. Winifred's Church is believed to have Saxon origins.In the Chancel is a 13th century 'Y' shaped lancet window. In the Nave, the choir stalls are 19th century.The picina behind the organ suggests there were altars on either side of the Chancel opening.The series of 18th century memorials to various local families contains excellent examples of lettering. The 15th century font was possibly repaired after being damaged by Puritans. The South Chapel is possibly 14th century because of the windows of the Decorated period. The Register Box of 1813 is fine cast-iron. The 15th century Tower is in Perpendicular style. The original studded oak door to the newell staircase leads to the belfry. The Altar is dated 1791, the black oak Lectern 1870 and the Organ 1907.
